Package net.iceyleagons.frostedengineering.modules

Class ModuleManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.iceyleagons.frostedengineering.modules.ModuleManager
  • public class ModuleManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    TOTHTOMI ("I suffered brain damage while I was trying to fix the errors&bugs of this class" - One of the Last words of TOTHTOMI --> Try to find more :)) This class handles and contains all of the modules, that get registered through our API or by us.

      This method can be used to disable modules individually.

      This method can be used to enable modules individually.
      void enableModules()
      This method is called when the plugin FrostedMain loaded®istered all the modules, and they're ready to be enabled It will invoke the methods with the MethodTypes.ON_ENABLE annotation type on them

    • Method Detail

      • registerModule

        public void registerModule​(@Nonnull
                           java.lang.Object obj)
        This will go through the class and check for annotations if founds one it will fill out the proper fields of ModuleClass
        Parameters:
        obj - is the Object where the module is located (Class)

      • enableModules

        public void enableModules()
        This method is called when the plugin FrostedMain loaded®istered all the modules, and they're ready to be enabled It will invoke the methods with the MethodTypes.ON_ENABLE annotation type on them

      • disableModules

        public void disableModules()
        This method is called when the plguin FrostedMain shuts down. It will invoke the methods with the MethodTypes.ON_DISABLE annotation type on them

      • enableModule

        public void enableModule​(@Nonnull
                         java.lang.String name)
                  throws javassist.NotFoundException
        This method can be used to enable modules individually. It will invoke the methods with the MethodTypes.ON_ENABLE annotation type on them
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the module
        Throws:
        javassist.NotFoundException - if there isn't any modules that has the set name.

      • disableModule

        public void disableModule​(@Nonnull
                          java.lang.String name)
                   throws javassist.NotFoundException
        This method can be used to disable modules individually. It will invoke the methods with the MethodTypes.ON_DISABLE annotation type on them
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the module
        Throws:
        javassist.NotFoundException - if there isn't any modules that has the set name.

      • getModule

        public ModuleClass getModule​(@Nonnull
                             java.lang.String name)
        This method can be used to gather the ModuleClass by using the module name
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the module
        Returns:
        the found ModuleClass (CAN BE NULL, SO WRITE A CHECK FOR IT)
